abstract: Google’s automated eyes tipped law enforcement about a Houston-area man whom the police say was using the company’s Gmail service to email pornographic images of a child.
snippet: Google’s automated eyes tipped law enforcement about a Houston-area man whom the police say was using the company’s Gmail service to email pornographic images of a child.
lead_paragraph: Federal law requires people and companies to report child exploitation when they see it. This includes Google, whose automated eyes tipped law enforcement about a Houston-area man whom the police say was using the company’s Gmail service to email pornographic images of a child.

headline.main: Google Gives Child Pornography Email Evidence to Police

abstract: A civil investigation is underway into the booming business of subprime auto lending. | The Gannett Company is spinning off its print operations. | Was Valeant’s deal with William A. Ackman too clever to be legal? | Google is sponsoring a conference this week in Sicily.
snippet: A civil investigation is underway into the booming business of subprime auto lending. | The Gannett Company is spinning off its print operations. | Was Valeant’s deal with William A. Ackman too clever to be legal? | Google is sponsoring a conferen...
lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors have begun a civil investigation into the booming business of subprime auto lending, focusing on the packaging and selling of questionable loans to investors, DealBook’s Michael Corkery and Jessica Silver-Greenberg write. The inquiry comes amid worries among regulators that checks and standards are being neglected as the subprime auto loan market surges, in a small, yet disturbing, echo of the subprime mortgage crisis, they write.

headline.main: Morning Agenda: Scrutiny of Subprime Auto Loans

abstract: A buying spree among technology companies has revolutionized the venture capital business model, Steven Davidoff Solomon writes in the Deal Professor.
snippet: A buying spree among technology companies has revolutionized the venture capital business model, Steven Davidoff Solomon writes in the Deal Professor.
lead_paragraph: Facebook, Google and other Internet titans have been busy transforming themselves into web conglomerates, making fortunes for the venture capital industry. But is it good for everyone else?

headline.main: New Buying Strategy as Facebook and Google Transform Into Web Conglomerates
headline.print_headline: New Strategy as Tech Giants Transform Into Conglomerates
